title: Is my TV a smart TV or not? - Quora

response.answer_text: Just to clarify. TVs are not smart. A ‘Smart’ TV is simply one which connects to the internet. If you have WiFi and/ or ethernet on the TV and you can get online content, it is a ‘Smart’ TV. If you, you can buy a set top box, such as an Apple TV. These plug in using an HDMI cable and add services like YouTube, Amazon Prime and BBC iPlayer using either WiFi or ethernet.

How should we know? Look up the model number, read the user manual. A “smart TV” will have an ethernet or WiFi connection, and will be able to play YouTube videos and USB sticks. A newer one can probably stream many different video services, use a Bluetooth keyboard, and browse the Web directly.
